After the initial breaking in period for the quest, which is my first real vr experience. I played quite a few games, even the sideload games via side quest. But by far my favorite game is Dead and Buried 2. It offers 5 game modes and 21 maps, which is enough to keep you entertained for a while.

My favorite game modes are (in this order), shootout, death match, horde, and survival. There is another mode called Quickdraw but I never see anyone playing.

Shoot out has 2 teams playing on either side of a map shooting at each other. You can move around in roomscale to hide behind objects and other cover. The first team to 25 kills wins.

Death match is classic death match, you use the joysticks or roomscale (if using full roomscale you would need quite a large area) to run around a map and kill eachother free for all style. The cool thing here is you can get to the floor and shoot under, behind, and between objects to get the kill.

Horde mode is similar to shoot out except you are killing zombie hordes coming at your team from all over the map. There are bosses and each wave gets harder than the last until you eventually lose.

Survival reminds me of the zombie mode in call of duty. You run around (again using room scale or joysticks on the controller).trying to kill zombies that spawn all while trying to move to the next area. Too many deaths and you lose.

Quickdraw, which is my least favorite (although it sticks to the wild west theme of the game) just has two players face off in a quick draw match. While a few rounds may be fun, it loses its draw after a few rounds. I so hardly see anyone play it.

Every one of these game modes includes multiple weapons (except quick draw) to find around each map. However you always have the basic revolvers at your hip to use.

My only request would be to see if other players are playing a certain game mode in each area. The game is presented as a town in which all the game modes are scattered around.
